document_data.name: Moria
document_data.mainbody: '''Moria''' was a [[vampire]] who briefly took up innkeeping the [[Journey's Rest]] alongside [[Ryanna]] in [[1369 DR]].
document_data.Description: Moria was a voluptuous woman who exuded a glow of good health, with blond hair and bright blue eyes.
document_data.Personality: When acting as a human, Moria was cheerful, flirtatious and kind. When the time came to strike, she was perfectly predatory and heartless towards her victims.
document_data.Abilities: Moria had the usual abilities of a vampire, including being able to take a [[gaseous form]].
document_data.Possessions: Moria carried a [[long sword]], which she had learned to use in her life as a [[fighter]].
document_data.Activities: Moria and Ryanna briefly operated the Journey's Rest inn near [[Hultail]], hoping to snare lonely travelers who wouldn't be missed.
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, Moria and Ryanna killed a married couple and their two handymen who had just finished renovating the abandoned Journey's Rest inn. Deciding to let their prey come to them, the vampires took up the inn for themselves and hired the barmaids [[Maris]] and [[Cora]]. Their first attempt was on the necromancer [[Ratakos]], who easily overpowered them and was then immediately offered a better deal. Ratakos would create undead that would attack travelers, prompting them to take shelter instead of passing by the inn. Moria and Ryanna would drain and kill the customer, and Ratakos would then receive the fresh body for his necromantic studies.

This new plan came apart less than a month later, when the merchant [[Portis Alvermantle]] fled the inn after suspecting something was wrong, Lord [[Rhyn Mournsoul]] and [[Alanis Dirgesong]] were too important to risk killing, and the only other potential victims were a group of adventurers. Depending on how the adventurers protected themselves, Moria and Ryanna either bided their time, or attacked and were driven out of the Journey's Rest.
